homepage.title: Blood donor recruitment
homepage.subtitle: All information on donation points, instructions for donors and status updates in one place.

screening.title: Matching simulation for blood donation
screening.description: The purpose of the simulation is to make sure you meet the MDA criteria for donating blood. If you are found suitable, it is recommended to go to a donation station, where you will have to fill out a health declaration, and undergo another test (blood pressure and hemoglobin).
screening.aboutForm: This form is based on the MDA form and they will be the factor that will finally determine your suitability for donating blood.

recentDonation.q: Have you donated blood in the last three months?
recentDonation.comment: The minimum between blood donations according to MDA criteria is at least three months. You cannot donate blood now.

age.under17comment: It is not possible to donate blood under the age of 17.
age.17to18comment: You can donate blood, but a parent/guardian signature will be required. You can download the appropriate form at the link: https://www.mdais.org/media/3384/mda-044-7905.pdf
age.60upComment: From the age of 60 if this is the first donation, a doctor's approval is required. From the age of 65, a doctor's approval is required before any donation.

pregnant.comment: It is not possible to donate blood during pregnancy.

birth.q: Have you given birth in the last six months?
birth.comment: It is not possible to donate blood after giving birth.

conditions.q: Do you suffer from one of the following conditions?
conditions.description:
- Cardiac problem/heart rhythm disorders that require drug treatment
- Hemophilia/epileptic disease treated with drug treatment
- Experience of an epilepsy attack in the last 5 years
conditions.comment: You cannot donate. Donating blood may put your health at risk.

antibiotics.q: Have you been treated with antibiotics in the last month?
antibiotics.yesAndHealed: Yes, I finished the treatment and recovered from the disease
antibiotics.yesAndNotHealed: Yes, I haven't finished the treatment yet and I'm still taking the antibiotics / I haven't recovered
antibiotics.comment: You cannot donate now, you must finish treatment before donating blood.

teeth.q: Have you had dental treatment recently?
teeth.description:
- Dentist in the last 24 hours
- Root canal/tooth extraction in the last week
- Dental implant in the last month?
teeth.comment: It is not possible to donate blood after dental treatment

hepatitis.q: Are you sick or have you been sick in the past with hepatitis (jaundice)?

hepatitis_A_notRecent.q: Did you recover and a year has passed since the date of recovery?

hepatitis_NA_notRecent.q: Did you recover and two years have passed since the date of recovery?

vaccine.q: Have you received a vaccine recently?
vaccine.description: Have you received a vaccine for one of the following diseases in the last month: rubella, measles, mumps, chicken pox, yellow fever?

asthma_yes_well.q: Are you feeling well, without an attack in the last week and not taking steroid pills?

diabetes_yes_balanced.q: Is diabetes balanced? (by diet or medication)

cancer.q: Are you sick or have you had a malignant disease in the past?
cancer.yesVirus: Yes, disease or history of hematological or virus-induced malignancy (leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease).

cancer_yesOther_beated.q: Has it been 5 years since the completion of the treatment and full recovery?

anemia.q: Do you have anemia or a tendency to bleed?

transfusion.q: Have you received a blood transfusion or blood components?

miscProcedures.q: Have you had a tattoo, piercing, permanent makeup or endoscopy with biopsy?

conclusion.didntFinish: You have not yet filled out the questionnaire

approve.title: You can go donate blood!
approve.description: Based on the data you filled in, you are eligible to donate blood. You can go to the nearest donation station, where you will be asked to complete forms and additional checks for the donation.

reject.title: Currently it is not possible to donate blood
reject.description: Thank you for your willingness to donate and save lives. We have found that you are currently ineligible to donate blood.
